titleStmt.title: Despatch from Peter Strickland to John Davis, October 6, 1883

bibl.title: Despatches from United States Consuls in Boma, 1888-1895
bibl.publisher: National Archives and Records Service General Services Administration

div1.ab: To the Honorable John David Acting Secretary of State Department of State Washington
div1.p: Sir:--- I have the honor herewith to transmit to you my acceptance of the appointment of the President as Consul of the United States at Goree-Dakar, with my Bond and Certificate of Oath of Allegiance both executed in due form before the US District Attorney in Boston.

In reply to your request for information I have to state that I was born in the Town of Montville, County of New London, State of Connnecticut, on the first day of August 1837. I have resided in Senegal many years, can make
myself understood in the French Congress and have been at several places in France particulairly Paris, Marseille + Bordeaux Members of my Family often reisde with me in Africa.

I expect to sail for Africa in about ten days and can take along with me whatever is sent from the Department. Everything which information with respect to my duties will be thankfully received. I am honored Sir, Very truly and respectfully Yours Peter Strickland
